intro: Spilanthes pammicrophylla, commonly known as the small-leaved toothache plant, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the genus Spilanthes, which is part of the family Asteraceae, also known as the sunflower family. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to dry, hot environments. The species is noted for its medicinal properties, particularly in traditional herbal remedies.
